newsitem.title: FRANCE: France hails Israel-PLO deal on Hebron.
newsitem.headline: France hails Israel-PLO deal on Hebron.

text.p: France hailed on Wednesday a deal between Israel and the PLO extending Palestinian rule to the West Bank town of Hebron and said the long-awaited accord should pave the way to other pacts to bolster peace in the Middle East.
"France welcomes the agreement between Israelis and Palestinians on the redeployment of the Israeli army in the town of Hebron," the foreign ministry said in a statement.
"This accord has been long awaited; France hopes that it will be implemented as quickly as possible," it said.

"This agreement should be a new departure for all aspects of the peace process," it said, adding: "Other parts of the interim accord on the autonomy of the West Bank and Gaza should now be quickly implemented."

Under the pact, Israel will hand over most of Hebron to Palestinian rule within 10 days. Negotiators initialled the accord on the border between Israel and the Gaza Strip at a late-night summit between Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian President Yasser Arafat.

France praised the tenacity of Israeli and Palestinian negotiators despite "tensions and difficulties". It also praised U.S. mediation and congratulated Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak and Jordan's King Hussein for their contribution.
"France will continue to support the implementation of autonomy and the construction of peace together with its European partners," it added.
